Key Match Events: Kyrie Irving and Luka Doncic combined for 38 points in a limited window of playing time.
Daniel Gafford top-scored all the Dallas frontcourt members with 22 points while also collecting seven rebounds.
The Mavericks scored a total of 38 points in the third quarter compared to San Antonio’s 18, the turning point in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Victor Wembanyama was sidelined due to a knee injury.
The Spurs gave up a bunch of paint points and allowed Dallas to dominate the shaded lane.
Post-Match Reflections: Irving equalized Gafford’s offensive production alongside eight rebounds and six assists while Doncic tallied 16 markers, six boards, and six dimes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game got out of hand with five minutes remaining in the fourth quarter.
The Spurs pulled out all of their starters with five minutes still remaining in the fourth.
